meanings.definition: To make something conform to the style or principles of ancient Greek and Roman art or literature.
meanings.sent1: She classicized her writing by using elegant language inspired by ancient Greek texts.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to classicize the sculpture by adding columns and intricate details.
meanings.sent3: In an attempt to classicize his outfit, he wore a toga to the modern party.
meanings.sent4: Her speech classicized the room, transporting everyone back to the time of ancient philosophers.
meanings.sent5: The garden classicized the backyard, with statues and fountains reminiscent of ancient Rome.

meanings.definition: To give something a classical or traditional appearance or quality.
meanings.sent1: The designer classicized the room with columns and marble floors.
meanings.sent2: By adding gold accents, she classicized the painting, giving it a timeless feel.
meanings.sent3: He classicized his car by painting it white and adding elegant details.
meanings.sent4: The old clock classicized the room, making it feel like a vintage treasure.
meanings.sent5: The music classicized the event, creating an atmosphere of sophistication and tradition.
